intro: Statice hirta subsp. baetica, commonly known as Spanish pink, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, showy clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showing a high tolerance for harsh environmental conditions. Its foliage is covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid climates. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant colors and drought-resistant properties.
